content: can omit some of the shawl border row do work at least four established and proceed to the shawl border section repeats of row 63 and 64 4 garter ridges to prevent the edge from curling if the yarn transitions on a rs row finish this row as established work row 1 one more time stitch patterns you will start the border on a rs row stitch counts are not important for this pattern if you accidentally shawl border miss an increase or decrease along the way just ignore it no one will see shawl border row section for row-by-row pattern instructions ever notice and everything will work out just fine unless you will notice and it will bother you in that case go ahead and fix it medium work row 1 - 62 then repeat row 63 and 64 until you have approximately 4 g 0 14 oz remaining the picot bind-off involves a knitted cast-on here s how to do it put your right-hand needle into the stitch on the left needle and knit a large work row 1-62 then row 15-30 then repeat row 63 and 64 stitch but do not drop any stitches off the left-hand needle instead until you have 5 g 0 18 oz remaining slip the new stitch back to the left-hand needle 1 stitch cast on if you do not have a scale the bind-off will take 4 times as much yarn now repeat the process knitting into the stitch you just created and as your last garter row approximately 10 - 15 meters adding this new stitch to the left hand needle bind off instructions bind-off may be done on either a ws or rs row picot bind-off bind off 4 stitches *slip one stitch from your right- yarn prep hand needle back to your left-hand needle cast on 2 sts using the wind yarn into a ball discard any white or pale yarn at the ends of knitted cast-on method bind off 6 stitches repeat from * until there the skein it is scrap yarn left over from the dyeing process are fewer than 4 stitches remaining bind off any remaining stitches determine which end of the yarn to use for the cast-on if you are using the whiskey in a teacup colourway this will be the yellow end finishing weave in ends set up wet block the shawl by allowing it to soak in a sink full of lukewarm cast on 6 stitches water for approximately 20 minutes squeeze out as much water as row 1 ws sl1 as if to purl with yarn in front p2tog p to 2 possible without twisting or stretching the piece stitches before end yo p2 6 sts on the needle lay flat and optionally use blocking wires and pins to stretch the row 2 rs sl1 as if to knit with yarn in back k1 yo k until end 7 shawl to the desired size a pin or blocking wire through each
